intro: Justicia vahlii, commonly known as the yellow flame plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Justicia vahlii thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
